xxl.core.io.fat
Class FileSystem

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.fat.FileSystem

public class FileSystem
extends Object

This class represents a file system. The file system manages devices. Each device is a raw partition, RandomAccessFile, or a RAM area. For each device there is one RawAccess object which supports the low level I/O-Operations on it.

Nested Class Summary

          This class contains information about the device objects.

Indicates the type of action to do. Boot the device of the file system.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

FileSystem

public FileSystem(String bootFileName,
                  PrintStream out,
                  File dummyFile)
Return a file system object.

Parameters:
bootFileName - Name of the file where the information of the devices is stored.
out - Output stream for some messages of the FATDevice. You can use System.out for example.
dummyFile - The extension of a RandomAccessFile needs a file that exists inside the OS-file system. The file is never used, just opened read only and immediately closed again. This parameter only exists because of the inflexible implementation of RandomAccessFile.
Method Detail

removeLine

public static boolean removeLine(String deviceName,
                                 String bootFileName)
Remove the whole line where the device with deviceName is stored from the file where all bootable devices are listed.

Parameters:
deviceName - the name of the device.
bootFileName - Name of the file where the information of the devices is stored.
Returns:
true in case the operation was succesfull; false otherwise.

getBootFileContent

public static String[] getBootFileContent(String bootFileName)
Return the lines of the bootFile as a string array. If the file is empty the returned string array will be empty, too.

Parameters:
bootFileName - Name of the file where the information of the devices is stored.
Returns:
the lines of the bootFile or an empty string array if there is no content.

isUnixDeviceName

public static boolean isUnixDeviceName(String name)
Check if the given device name eqauls a unix device name. That is the name has as prefix "/dev/X", where X is the name of the device.

Parameters:
name - the name of the device.
Returns:
true in case the given name eqauls a unic device name, otherwise false is returned.

initialize

public FATDevice initialize(String deviceName,
                            RawAccess rawAccess,
                            byte fatType,
                            byte actionType)
                     throws WrongFATType,
                            WrongLength,
                            InitializationException
Return a FATDevice which supports all file system operations on the raw device specified by device name. The I/O-opeartions are supported by the RawAccess file. If the requested device already exist no new device will be created. The method returns the existing device. For a FAT12 file system the length of rawAccess must be smaller than 4084 blocks. For a FAT16 file system the length of rawAccess must be smaller than 4194304 512-byte-blocks and bigger than 32680 512-byte-blocks. For a FAT32 file system the length of rawAccess must be smaller than 0xFFFFFFFF bytes. and bigger than 532480 512-byte-blocks.

Parameters:
deviceName - the name of the device.
rawAccess - the raw access file which supports the I/O-Operations.
fatType - the type of FAT that should be formatted. In case you boot the device you can set fatType as UNKNOWN. The device will recognize by itself what kind of FAT it is.
actionType - indicated the action to do, that are BOOT an existing device or FORMAT the partition whith the given fat type.
Returns:
the device object.
Throws:
WrongFATType - if the given fatType is neither FAT.FAT12, nor FAT.FAT16, nor FAT.FAT32.
WrongLength - if the number of blocks of rawAccess are to big for the given fatType.
InitializationException - in case the device object couldn't be initialized.

getDevice

public FATDevice getDevice(String deviceName)
                    throws Exception
Return the device object given by deviceName.

Parameters:
deviceName - name of the device.
Returns:
the device object.
Throws:
Exception - in case the device could not be found.

shutDown

public void shutDown()
Call this method when you finished your work with the file system. If you don't call it, the next time you boot the file system checkdisk will start and you may lose some important information.

unmount

public void unmount(String deviceName)
Unmount the device given by deviceName.

Parameters:
deviceName - name of the device.

unmount

public void unmount(FATDevice device)
Unmount the given device.

Parameters:
device - to unmount.

getAllDevices

public List getAllDevices()
List the available devices. Each device has a root directory from which all other files in that file system can be reached. This method returns a list of DeviceInformation objects which contains information about each device.

Returns:
list of DeviceInformation objects with all mounted devices.
See Also:
FileSystem.DeviceInformation
